SHA256 CTRL

Absolute Address:
Base Offset:
0x10
Size:
0x4

Description

SHA256 component control register type definition. After each software write, hardware will erase the register.

Contents

Bits Identifier Access Reset Decoded Name
[31:10] - - - -
[9] WNTZ_N_MODE w 0x0 -
[8:5] WNTZ_W w 0x4 -
[4] WNTZ_MODE w 0x0 -
[3] ZEROIZE w 0x0 -
[2] MODE w 0x1 -
[1] NEXT w 0x0 -
[0] INIT w 0x0 -

Field Descriptions

WNTZ_N_MODE

Control Winternitz n value(SHA192/SHA256 --> n = 24/32)

Property Value
resetsignal ^.^.reset_b

WNTZ_W

Control Winternitz W value

Property Value
resetsignal ^.^.reset_b

WNTZ_MODE

Control Winternitz verification mode command bits
Software write generates only a single-cycle pulse on the hardware interface and then will be erased

Property Value
resetsignal ^.^.reset_b

ZEROIZE

Zeroize all internal registers: Zeroize all internal registers after SHA process, to avoid SCA leakage.
Software write generates only a single-cycle pulse on the hardware interface and then will be erased

Property Value
resetsignal ^.^.reset_b

MODE

Control mode command bits: Indicates the SHA256 core to set dynamically the type of hashing algorithm. This can be: 0 for SHA256/224 1 for SHA256

Property Value
resetsignal ^.^.reset_b

NEXT

Control next command bit: â€‹Trigs the SHA256 core to start the processing for the remining padded message block.
Software write generates only a single-cycle pulse on the hardware interface and then will be erased

Property Value
resetsignal ^.^.reset_b

INIT

Control init command bit: Trigs the SHA256 core to start the processing for the first padded message block.
Software write generates only a single-cycle pulse on the hardware interface and then will be erased

Property Value
resetsignal ^.^.reset_b
